docs.title: Here is an index page
docs.text:
Let's make sure we have LaTeX working for math.

\[ \int x^2 dx = {1\over3} x^3 + C \]

Looks good.

docs.title: Let's try mermaid for diagrams
docs.text:
graph TD;
    A[Start] --> B[Process 1];
    B --> C[Decision];
    C -->|Yes| D[Process 2];
    C -->|No| E[End];
    D --> E;

docs.title: Useful Commands
docs.text:
1. Create a new project: mkdocs new .
  2. Serve the documentation locally: mkdocs serve
  3. Build the static site: mkdocs build
  4. Deploy to GitHub Pages: mkdocs gh-deploy

docs.title: Pushing to GitHub with Material Theme
docs.text:
1. Ensure your mkdocs.yml includes the Material theme configuration. See parent directory.

  2. Commit your changes:

git add .
git commit -m "Add Material theme and documentation"
  1. Push to GitHub:
git push origin master
  1. Deploy to GitHub Pages:
mkdocs gh-deploy

This command builds your site and pushes it to the gh-pages branch, making it available on GitHub Pages with the Material theme.
